intro: Pupalia styracifolia, commonly known as the Indian snowball, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring dense clusters of white, fluffy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their showy appearance. Pupalia styracifolia thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
